mangan

Class Visualisation

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Panel
          • java.applet.Applet
            • processing.core.PApplet
              • mangan.Visualisation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, processing.core.PConstants

    public class Visualisation
extends processing.core.PApplet
    The main Visualization which is based on Processing (http://www.processing.org/) for the main animation part and based on a Processing library called ControlP5 (http://www.sojamo.de/libraries/controlP5/) for the menu part.
    Version:
    1.8
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main application which reads files, if inserted from the command-line. After the reading, we instantiate the processing object.
        Parameters:
        args - Command-line arguments.

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Processing configuration before running the main scheduler.
        Overrides:
        setup in class processing.core.PApplet

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Processings draw() runs forevery and renders all the GUI.
        Overrides:
        draw in class processing.core.PApplet

      • drawStats

        public void drawStats()
        Draws the statistics which are relevant for the informaticup. We manipulate the values by shortening them to two decimal places.

      • drawRobots

        public void drawRobots()
        Draws every robot by calling it's display() method as long as we have at least one robot.

      • drawRobotsFirstTime

        public void drawRobotsFirstTime()
        Draws all the robots from the simulator objects as soon as we push the start button.

      • createRobot

        public void createRobot(int x,
                        int y)
        Creates a robot in the simulator and also in the local robots HashMap to later draw them.
        Parameters:
        x - is the x position.
        y - is the y position.

      • moveRobots

        public void moveRobots()
        Move every displayed robot to the position, the simulator calculated.

      • calculate_weights

        public void calculate_weights(int a)
        Calculate the best weights of a lot of iterations.
        Parameters:
        a - unused id value given to it from ControlP5 object.

      • weight1

        public void weight1(java.lang.String a)
        Set weight for algorithm 1.
        Parameters:
        a - unused id value given to it from ControlP5 object.

      • weight2

        public void weight2(java.lang.String a)
        Set weight for algorithm 2.
        Parameters:
        a - unused id value given to it from ControlP5 object.

      • weight3

        public void weight3(java.lang.String a)
        Set weight for algorithm 3.
        Parameters:
        a - unused id value given to it from ControlP5 object.

      • gather

        public void gather(int a)
        Tell simulator to gather all robots. Since this is triggered manually via a ControlP5 button, this can cause situations where the robots start to cluster in different groups.
        Parameters:
        a - unused id value given to it from ControlP5 object.

      • deployAlgorithm

        public void deployAlgorithm(int a)
        Radiobutton calls this method to set the deployment algorithm. If one clicks one "MANUAL", manual gets set to true to prevent newly created robots at a click on start.
        Parameters:
        a - the value of the used radiobutton.

      • start

        public void start(int a)
        Start the visualisation of the simulation. If we aren't on manual, we use the simulator to create robots in the defined deployment algorithm. Then we use drawRobotsFirstTime() to get all robots from the simulator and draw them to the GUI.
        Parameters:
        a - unused id value given by the ControlP5 object.

      • clearRobots

        public void clearRobots(int a)
        Stops the drawing of new robots and clears all robots from the simulator and also the local robots HashMap.
        Parameters:
        a - unused id value given by the ControlP5 object.

      • Robots

        public void Robots(java.lang.String a)
        Set the amount of robots, value between 2 and 100.
        Parameters:
        a - unused id value given by the ControlP5 object.

      • ViewingRange

        public void ViewingRange(java.lang.String a)
        Set the viewing range of robots.
        Parameters:
        a - unused id value given by the ControlP5 object.

      • pause

        public void pause(int a)
        Pause the simulation.
        Parameters:
        a - unused id value given by the ControlP5 object.

      • save

        public void save(int a)
        Save current run to file via the simulator.
        Parameters:
        a - unused id value given by the ControlP5 object.

      • exit

        public void exit(int a)
        Exit the application.
        Parameters:
        a - unused id value given by the ControlP5 object.

      • controlEvent

        public void controlEvent(controlP5.ControlEvent theEvent)
        Deprecated. jup, we don't need this anymore.
        ControlP5 controller which gets called at every interaction with the ControlP5 elements. Isn't in use anymore.
        Parameters:
        theEvent - a unused event handler of ControlP5.

      • getValuesFromFile

        public static void getValuesFromFile(java.lang.String string)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Read values from a file. Only possible if specified from CLI.
        Parameters:
        string - the filename assigned by the CLI.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getTFtext

        public void getTFtext()
        Read values from all Textfields and writes it to the depending variables.
